content.statement: carotid-004-plaque-morphology is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Carotid-Disease that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding carotid-004-plaque-morphology helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of carotid-004-plaque-morphology include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of carotid-004-plaque-morphology.

vulnerable_features.intraplaque_hemorrhage: Blood within plaque - seen as T1 hyperintense on MRI
vulnerable_features.lipid_rich_necrotic_core: Large necrotic core (>40% volume) increases risk

ultrasound.gsm: Gray Scale Median - lower values = more lipid

ct.hua: Hounsfield Unit Analysis - lipid vs calcium

clinical_implications.moderate_stenosis_50_69%: Vulnerable features may lower intervention threshold
clinical_implications.mild_stenosis: Vulnerable plaque under investigation as intervention indication

definition.@value: Characteristics of carotid atherosclerotic plaque that determine stability and stroke risk, beyond stenosis degree

clinical_pearls: Echolucent (dark) plaque on ultrasound = lipid-rich = higher risk
Intraplaque hemorrhage on MRI = T1 bright (hyperintense) = 4-7x stroke risk
Ulceration depth >2mm is significant for stroke risk
Consider plaque features when deciding on intervention for 50-69% stenosis

medicalCode.description: Occlusion and stenosis of carotid artery

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.
